document_data.name: Iron cobra
document_data.language: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
document_data.mainbody: '''Iron cobras''' were a type of serpentine [[construct]]. They were favored by the [[Scaled Ones]] for their snakelike form.<ref>
document_data.Description:
These constructs were typically made of [[iron]], though some consisted of unknown metals.

<!--==Behavior==-->

Abilities.Offensive: Iron cobras were venomous, with an internal reservoir that held three doses of poison, though said reservoir could be refilled in but a minute. The exact type of poison varied, although venom from a [[monstrous spider]] was a common choice. Some loaded them with alchemical concoctions that paralyze creatures or cloud their minds with paranoia.

document_data.Combat: Iron cobras' combat tactics were simple, but typically effective: bite until the enemy died.

Ecology.Creation: Iron cobras could be created from {{SI|100|lb|long=yes}} of iron by a caster of above-average skill who could cast both arcane and divine spells. The creation process also required use of the spells ''[[animate object]]'', ''[[freedom of movement]]'', ''[[geas/quest]]'', and ''[[locate creature]]''.

document_data.History: It was said that the first eight iron cobras were created ages ago by a powerful wizard-cleric, and that they were indestructible. Other spellcasters after them tried to copy the design, but with uniformly less powerful results.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Some claimed that there were only a dozen or so iron cobras in existence.
